intro: Matelea stapeliiflora, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its unique, spathaceous inflorescence that resembles a ghostly face. The plant is known for its striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with a distinctive hooded shape. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought. Due to its unusual appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
